    • Method Detail

      • validateDescription

        public static void validateDescription(java.util.List<Gdl> description)
                                throws ValidatorException
        Validates whether a GDL description follows the rules of GDL, to the extent that it can be determined. If the description is invalid, throws an exception of type ValidatorException explaining the problem. Features like finitism and monotonicity can't be definitively determined with a static analysis; these are left to the other validator. (See GdlValidator and the ValidatorPanel in apps.validator.)
        Parameters:
        description - A parsed GDL game description.
        Throws:
        ValidatorException - The description did not pass validation. The error message explains the error found in the GDL description.

      • matchParentheses

        public static void matchParentheses(java.io.File file)
                             throws ValidatorException
        Tests whether the parentheses in a given file match correctly. If the parentheses are unbalanced, gives the line number of an unmatched parenthesis.
        Parameters:
        file - The .kif file to test.
        Throws:
        ValidatorException - The parentheses are unbalanced. The line number of an unmatched parenthesis is included in the error message.

      • checkValidity

        public void checkValidity(Game theGame)
                   throws ValidatorException
        Specified by:
        checkValidity in interface GameValidator
        Throws:
        ValidatorException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Tries to test most of the rulesheets in the games directory. This should be run when developing a new game to spot errors.
